gurmukhi: iQr rhy biRC aupvn ikDo au`qr ids duAY Acl ]500]
transliteration: Thir Rahe Brichh Ouphan Kidho Jan Outtar Dis Duai Achal||500||
translation: As if they are large trees in a forest or eternal and immovable pole-stars in the north.500.

gurmukhi: ju`ty bIrM ] Cu`ty qIrM ] Fu`kI FwlM ] kRohy kwlM ]501]
transliteration: Joutte Bderan|| Chhoutte Tderan|| Doukkidhaalan|| Krohe Kaalan||501||
translation: The warriors fought, the arrows were discharged, there was knocking on the shields and the death-like warriors were infuriated.501.

gurmukhi: FMky FolM ] bMky bolM ] k`Cy ssqRM ] A`Cy AsqRM ]502]
transliteration: Dhanke Dholan|| Banke Bolan|| Kachchhe Sastran|| Achchhe Astran||502||
translation: The drums sounded, the blows of the swords were heard and the weapons and arrows were struck.502.

gurmukhi: kRoDM gilqM ] boDM dlqM ] g`jY vIrM ] q`jY qIrM ]503]
transliteration: Krodhan Gaditan|| Bodhan Dalatan|| Gadjai Vderan|| Tajjai Tderan||503||
translation: Highly infuriated and with great understanding, the forces are being mashed, the warriors are thundering and showering arrows.503.

gurmukhi: r`qy nYxM ] m`qy bYxM ] lu`JY sUrM ] su`JY hUrM ]504]
transliteration: Ratte Nainan|| Matte Bainan|| Lujjhai Sooran|| Sujjhai Hooran||504||
translation: The warriors with red eyes are shouting, having been intoxicated they are fighting and the heavenly damsels are looking at them.504.

gurmukhi: l`gYN qIrM ] B`gYN vIrM ] rosM ru`JY ] A`sqRM ju`JY ]505]
transliteration: Laggadn Tderan|| Haggadn Vderan|| Rosan Rujjhai|| Astran Jujjhai||505||
translation: Having been pierced by arrows, the warriors are fleeing and (some) are fighting with arms, being highly enraged.505.

gurmukhi: Ju`my sUrM ] Gu`my hUrM ] c`kYN cwrM ] b`kYN mwrM ]506]
transliteration: Jhoumme Sooran|| Ghoumme Hooran|| Chakkain Chaaran|| Bakkain Maaran||506||
translation: The warriors are swinging and the heavenly damsels, while wandering, are looking at them and are wondering on listening to their shouts of “Kill, Kill”.506.

gurmukhi: iB`dy brmM ] iC`dy crmM ] qu`tY K`gM ] au`TY AMgM ]507]
transliteration: Bhidde Harman|| Chhidde Charman|| Touttai Khadganng|| Outthai Aggadg||507||
translation: The weapons, coming into contact with armours, are piercing the bodies; the spars are breaking and the sparks of fire are coming out from them.507.

gurmukhi: n`cy qwjI ] g`jy gwjI ] if`gy vIrM ] q`jy qIrM ]508]
transliteration: Nachche Taajee|| Gadje Gadjee|| Digge Bderan|| Tajje Tderan||508||
translation: The horses are dancing and the warriors are thundering; they are falling while discharging the arrows.508.

gurmukhi: Ju`myN sUrM ] Gu`mI hUrM ] k`Cy bwxM ] m`qy mwxM ]509]
transliteration: Jhoummen Sooran|| Ghoummihooran|| Kachchhe Baanan Matte Maanan||509||
translation: Seeing the heavenly damsels moving, the warriors are swinging and, being intoxicated, are discharging arrows.509.

gurmukhi: qh BXo Gor Awhv Apwr ] rx BUMim JUim ju`Jy juJwr ]
transliteration: Tah Bhayo Ghor Aahav Apaar|| Ran Bhoonm(i) Jhoom(i) Jujjhe Jujhaar||
translation: In this way, the war ensued and many warriors fell in the field;

gurmukhi: ieq rwm BRwq Aqkwie au`q ] irs ju`J au`Jry rwj pu`q ]510]
transliteration: Ik Raam Bhraat Atkaae Outt|| Ris Jujjh Ujjhre Raaj Poutt||510||
translation: On one side there is Lakshman, brother of Ram and on the other there is the demon Atkaaye and both these princes are fighting with each other.510.
